conclusion: Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
On a v-t graph, the slope of the tangent at any point gives the instantaneous acceleration.
If the slope is positive, the acceleration is positive (speeding up). If the slope is negative, the acceleration is negative (slowing down).
The v-t graph for Car A consists of two identical arcs.
From t = 0 to t = 2 seconds, the velocity increases from 0 m/s to 2 m/s.
From t = 2 to t = 4 seconds, the velocity decreases from 2 m/s back to 0 m/s.

premise: The slope of the curve is positive from t = 0 to t = 2 seconds.
conclusion: The acceleration is positive during this interval.

premise: The slope of the curve is negative from t = 2 to t = 4 seconds.
conclusion: The acceleration is negative during this interval.

premise: At t = 2 seconds, the slope changes from positive to negative.
conclusion: The direction of acceleration changes from positive to negative at t = 2 seconds.
